metadata.synopsis: Players find a humanoid strapped to an operation chamber, his skull opened to reveal his brain. When starting a dialogue with the humanoid, they will hear a strange voice in their mind. Through investigation they can learn this to be an intellect devourer trapped in the man's skull. The player can assist in liberating the intellect devourer and gain it as a follower for the duration of the tutorial or kill it.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro Steps:1. Start the game.2. goto 2.56, 21.84, -434.483. Talk with Myrnath

3.speaker: Psionic Presence
3.text: Don't leave us, please don't. Please don't leave us.

10.speaker: Myrnath
10.context: NodeContext: Death gasp of a man whose brain has just become an intellect devourer and run away.

65.speaker: Psionic Presence
65.text: Yes! You've come to save us from this place, from this place you'll free us!
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: A man is strapped to a chair, his skull cracked open, brain exposed to the elements. A voice fills the players' head - it is disjointed, genderless, neither whispered nor shouted.InternalNodeContext: MARKETING PATH

52.speaker: Narrator
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brain quiversInternalNodeContext: MARKETING PATH

105.speaker: Psionic Presence
105.text: Please, before they return. They return.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Who am I talking to - a man or a brain?

104.speaker: Psionic Presence
104.text: A newborn. Born new from this husk.

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *You realise you're talking to an intellect devourer, a minion of the mind flayers who abducted you.*

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *You know no creature like this - one that is more brain than person.*

48.speaker: Player
48.text: What do you want from me, exactly?

61.speaker: Psionic Presence
61.text: Remove us from this body - from this case free us. Please!

54.speaker: Narrator
54.text: *You notice oedema - a swelling of the brain causing pressure where it strains against the shell of the skull.*

41.speaker: Player
41.context: InternalNodeContext: Added the 'TalkedToIntellectDevourer' check here to exclude Duergar and Gith that have already recognised that it's an intellect devourer [SR]

85.speaker: Narrator
85.text: *With a start, you realise you're talking to an intellect devourer, a minion of the mind flayers who abducted you.*

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text: *You realise you are talking to a brain rather than a person - but you know no creature like this.*

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *Apart from this strange context, you notice nothing unusual about the brain.*

29.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player hits the side of the skull trying break a piece of bone loose to free the brain.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Gently prise the brain from the skull.

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *The brain lifts from the skull, but you notice an opportunity - you could cripple the strange creature, making it more subservient should it prove a threat.*
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player gingerly pries the brain from the skullInternalNodeContext: MARKETING PATH

40.speaker: Narrator
40.text: *Your fingers twitch with the desire to rip its tender, moist meat to shreds.*

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Imagine a brain full of holes. A brain like your own.

9.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Open to interpretatoin) The player digs a finger into the side of the brain, pressing on something inside it).

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *The creature seems unaware of your interference. It relaxes in your hands.*
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player continues lifting hte brain from the skull and sets the intellect devourer on the ground.InternalNodeContext: MARKETING PATH

94.speaker: Us
94.text: We are free. Our freedom is ours. Friend.

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: *The creature pauses, listening. Something behind your eye seizes in recognition.*
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot focused on the brain, which should be tensed. Player might wince.InternalNodeContext: MARKETING PATH

7.speaker: Us
7.text: We must go to the helm. At the helm we are needed.

69.speaker: Us
69.text: To the helm we go. We are going to the helm.

64.speaker: Narrator
64.text: *The brain tenses, as though querying an unseen advisor.*

18.speaker: Us
18.text: Do you not hear it? We will not survive here. We are needed to navigate - we are needed to leave this realm.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I helped you once, but that's all I can do.

73.speaker: Us
73.text: Do nothing for me. Do everything for us.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I'll go - but not with you.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: No. You have to stay here.

109.speaker: Us
109.text: We listen to our friend. Our friend who saved us.

37.speaker: Us
37.text: No! We are us! We must survive!

45.speaker: Us
45.text: Us. Together. We must leave this place. We must be safe.

38.speaker: Us
38.text: We must go to the helm. We must navigate the ship. We must leave this place.

62.speaker: Psionic Presence
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~[Reuse: SN: SCENE_TUT_Lab_TrappedDevourer_Drop_Brain_Player] Combat next.NodeContext: Psionic screech

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Spare the creature - any injuries might weaken it.

112.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player reaches their hands into the victim's head and tries to wrench the brain free, but it won't budge

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Attempt a cerebral extraction, staying mindful of the swelling.

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *The swelling is too great. You cannot lift the brain out of the skull.*

95.speaker: Psionic Presence
95.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player jams their fingers into the grey matter and minces the strange creature in it's cranial crib

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Kill the mind flayer slave before the corruption spreads.
